abstract: General Electric has agreed to buy Vetco Gray, a maker of oil and gas-drilling and production equipment, for $1.9 billion to profit from surging demand for energy exploration. G.E., the world’s second-biggest company by market value, is acquiring Houston-based Vetco from three private equity firms, the 3i Group, Candover Investments  and J.P. Morgan Partners.
